meanings.definition: To place or locate in a particular position or situation.
meanings.sent1: I will situate the chair next to the table.
meanings.sent2: She decided to situate her desk by the window for better lighting.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to situate itself on the narrow windowsill, but kept slipping off.
meanings.sent4: His new job will situate him in the heart of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The map helped us situate ourselves in the unfamiliar town.

meanings.definition: To be in a particular position or place.
meanings.sent1: The old house sits situated on top of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The playground is situated right next to the school building.
meanings.sent3: The misplaced hat ended up situated on the dog's head.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite spot to situate herself is under the big oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins are situated deep within the dense forest.
